<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><Highlight kind="comment">//===------ GlobalMergeFunctions.h - Global merge functions -----&#42;- C++ -&#42;-===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This pass defines the implementation of a function merging mechanism</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that utilizes a stable function hash to track differences in constants and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// identify potential merge candidates. The process involves two rounds:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1 The first round collects stable function hashes and identifies merge</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    candidates with matching hashes. It also computes the set of parameters</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    that point to different constants during the stable function merge.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 2 The second round leverages this collected global function information to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    optimistically create a merged function in each module context, ensuring</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    correct transformation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Similar to the global outliner, this approach uses the linker&#39;s deduplication</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// (ICF) to fold identical merged functions, thereby reducing the final binary</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// size. The work is inspired by the concepts discussed in the following paper:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// https://dl.acm.org/doi/pdf/10.1145/3652032.3657575.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;GLOBALMERGEFUNCTIONS&#95;H</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><Highlight kind="comment">/// GlobalMergeFunc is a ModulePass that implements a function merging mechanism</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// using stable function hashes. It identifies and merges functions with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// matching hashes across modules to optimize binary size.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalmergefunc"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalmergefunc/#a4e65eb92bb3d24fdabb50564dd6e47c8">GlobalMergeFunc</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the constant values. Note that the original function, without this suffix,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// becomes a thunk supplying contexts to the merged function via parameters.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
